means: 庇护( shelter的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Stand the plant in the open in a sunny, sheltered place.
sentence.Network_cn: 把这株植物放在一个阳光充足、上方有遮盖物的开阔处。

sentence.Network_en: For the last few years I have been living in sheltered accommodation.
sentence.Network_cn: 最近几年我一直住在福利院里。

sentence.Network_en: My mother, who had a sheltered upbringing, has fantastic memories of childhood.
sentence.Network_cn: 我妈妈在呵护下长大，对童年有着非常美好的回忆。

entry.tran: 不受风雨侵袭的;有遮蔽物的
entry.def: A sheltered place is protected from wind and rain.

example.ex: ...a shallow-sloping beach next to a sheltered bay.
example.tran: 有天然屏障的海湾旁的一个缓坡海滩

entry.tran: 受庇护的;处处受保护的
entry.def: If you say that someone has led a sheltered life, you mean that they have been protected from difficult or unpleasant experiences.

example.ex: Perhaps I've just led a really sheltered life...
example.tran: 也许我一直过的就是一种呵护备至的生活。

example.ex: My mother, who had a sheltered upbringing, has fantastic memories of childhood.
example.tran: 我妈妈在呵护下长大，对童年有着非常美好的回忆。

entry.tran: (住所或工作)适于老人(或残疾人)的，福利性的
entry.def: Sheltered accommodation or work is designed for old or disabled people. It allows them to be independent but also allows them to get help when they need it.

example.ex: For the last few years I have been living in sheltered accommodation.
example.tran: 最近几年我一直住在福利院里。

example.ex: ...sheltered employment for people with severe disabilities.
example.tran: 为身体严重残疾的人提供的福利性工作

means.word_mean: 1. protected from danger or bad weather;

auth_sentence.content: Investors have access to a range of tax-sheltered accounts.
auth_sentence.res_content: Investors have access to a range of tax-sheltered accounts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Investors have access to a range of tax-sheltered accounts.

auth_sentence.content: My own sheltered childhood ended with the Cultural Revolution.
auth_sentence.res_content: My own sheltered childhood ended with the Cultural Revolution.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: My own sheltered childhood ended with the Cultural Revolution.

Sentence.sentence: Are teenagers in particular, do you think, sheltered too much from contact with the opposite sex?
They are better sheltered from all the outside temptations

sentences.en: The climbers rested on a sheltered ledge jutting out from the cliff.
sentences.cn: 登山者在悬崖的岩棚上休息。

sentences.en: The hotel is situated on the sheltered shores of the Moray Firth.
sentences.cn: 旅馆位于马里湾的下风岸。

means.word_mean: (尤指为病弱者)提供食宿的,提供抚养方便的

sentences.en: Many old people choose to live in sheltered accommodation.
sentences.cn: 许多老年人选择到养老院居住。
